intro: Mormodes hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's mormod, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, particularly in countries like Guatemala and Honduras. The plant features showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Mormodes hookeri is typically found in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests.
